content: Great write up, Tristan. You basically nailed the stage we’re at with Tettra as a team of six people. I agree that teams shouldn’t spend a lot of time or resources setting up robust analytics infrastructure in the beginning, but I do think it’s important to develop a culture of analytical thinking from the start. We’re working on that at Tettra by investing in setting up analytics, tracking metrics on regular cadences and using data to make informed decisions as much as we can. It’s hard, but we think it’ll be the key to scaling decision making later on. Do you have any suggestions for teams on how they can develop a data culture from the start?
